channel.title: My baby... AutoColor 2.1

item.title: My baby... AutoColor 2.1
item.dc:creator: @WhiteShadow WhiteShadow
item.description:
@WhiteShadow wrote:

Great job man! I’m surprised of how much you progressed in such short of a time.

Try this though, it’s 2x shorter.
[scar]
function IsColorInArray (TheColor : Integer; TheArray: array of Integer; ArraySize : Integer) : Boolean;
var
i : Integer;
begin
for i:= 0 to ArraySize - 1 do
begin
if(SameValue(TheColor, TheArray[i]))then
Result:= True;
end;
end;
[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: My baby... AutoColor 2.1
item.dc:creator: @roberty_bob roberty bob
item.description:
@roberty_bob wrote:

Pm me the exact script you are using… I’ll sort it out for you… I’m going away just now for several hours though… so I’ll do it when i get back…

I’m pretty sure it will jsut be the loop increments and so on… they are really the only thing that changes much. It is obviously finishing the loops, but by the sounds of it… you are passing through them very rapidly, which suggests your loop increments are too large. thats the purpose of the dual layer searching… if the first rapid scan doesn’t get them all in 1 second… the second scan never lets you down.

back later…

Read full topic

item.title: My baby... AutoColor 2.1
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

It’s ok.

Alright, I got it to pass all errors, but it doesn’t find any of the colors. I increased the MaxTolerance to 40, and changed the colors in the chicken array, with still no avail.

The colors for your chosen object have been selected and 0/5 were dynamically changed from the reference array. You really need to change the parameters. Try increasing the tolerance?

It moves the mouse a couple of times, but mostly just to barrels and stuff, never over a chicken.

Sorry for bugging you again.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @roberty_bob roberty bob
item.description:
@roberty_bob wrote:

Sorry mate… my bad for not reading your first posted error properly… you just need to put SetupSRL; in your main loop… since my autocolor uses IsUpText…

keep me posted… the thing about a function of this size, is it works perfect for me because I know what it is doing!!. so no problems helping you learn how it works.

Only against noobs going “how do I make an array of colors” or so on.

@Cheesehunk wrote:

Alright, thanks.

I still am getting this error after a while of searching:

incC =1 searching for color within limits I've found a potential color for further checking! [Runtime Error] : Exception: Canvas does not allow drawing in line 169 in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\includes\srl\srl\core\Text.scar

Sorry for troubling you with all these problems, I feel so nooby.

item.title: My baby... AutoColor 2.1
item.dc:creator: @roberty_bob roberty bob
item.description:
@roberty_bob wrote:

hehe just decrease the boxsizelimit to about 450?.. I should have changed that before posting…
500 makes the y coordinate go outside the java client… even though I relatively scaled them…

all those search parameters are really important… the color array you are passing in is overkill too… just pass in these ones below which work perfectly for me. Motion is no problem for it. it can be configured to trace motion, but isn’t currently. For a chicken my colors are quite unique, so make the box start quite large… the tolerance searching will be the key component of the search.

setarraylength(Chicken,4);
Chicken[0]:= 924798 ;
Chicken[1]:= 1672384;
Chicken[2]:= 2024936;
Chicken[3]:= 7703954;

Read full topic

item.title: My baby... AutoColor 2.1
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

I keep getting an error, I put Debug on to show you where it messes up:

incC =2 searching for color within limits I've found a potential color for further checking! [Runtime Error] : Exception: Canvas does not allow drawing in line 169 in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\includes\srl\srl\core\Text.scar

It’s pretty cool by the way. Am I not supposed to use moving objects such as Chickens?
Heres my Setup for everyone to use: (If you want me to remove it, I will, so noobs can figure it out themselves.)

[code]{.include SRL\SRl.scar}
var ChickenColor: Array [0…10] of Integer;

Procedure SetArray;
begin
ChickenColor[0]:= 924544;
ChickenColor[1]:= 1121675;
ChickenColor[2]:= 595305;
ChickenColor[3]:= 5008776;
ChickenColor[4]:= 5537172;
ChickenColor[5]:= 1616592;
ChickenColor[6]:= 6328490;
ChickenColor[7]:= 3163992;
ChickenColor[8]:= 5208714;
ChickenColor[9]:= 3889256;
ChickenColor[10]:= 6921657;
end;
{*******************************************************************************
function IsColorInArray (var TheColor:integer ; TheArray: array of Integer; ArraySize:integer):boolean;
By: Roberty Bob
Description: Returns true if the specified color is found in the array.
*******************************************************************************}
function IsColorInArray (var TheColor:integer ; TheArray: array of Integer; ArraySize:integer):boolean;
var
ColorFound: boolean;
var
i: integer;

begin
ColorFound:= false;
i:= 0;

repeat
if TheArray[i]= TheColor then
begin
ColorFound:= true;
break;
end;
i:= i+1;
until i = (ArraySize)

result:= ColorFound;
end;

{*******************************************************************************
function FindAllColorsInBoxTolerance(var x,y: integer; ColorArray: array of Integer; BoxSize,Tol:integer):boolean;
By: Roberty Bob
Description: Pass in an array of object colors with principal reference color in Array[0]
Returns true if all the colors were found in a box surrounding the principal reference color.
*******************************************************************************}
function FindAllColorsInBoxTolerance(var x,y: integer; ColorArray: array of Integer; BoxSize,Tol:integer):boolean;

var
i,j,a1,b1,HBox,ArraySize,Sx,Sy,Ex,Ey: integer;
var
AllFound,ColorMissing: boolean;

begin
//******** Set these to your specific search area, to make function more efficient.
Sx:= MSX1; //currently main screen
Sy:= MSY1;
Ex:= MSX2;
Ey:= MSY2;
//********
HBox:= (BoxSize/2);
ColorMissing:= false;
AllFound:= false;
ArraySize:= GetArrayLength(ColorArray);
x:= MSCX-250+random(500);
y:= MSCY-200+random(400);

repeat
FindColorSpiralTolerance(x,y,ColorArray[0],Sx,Sy,Ex,Ey,Tol);
a1:= x;
b1:= y;
i:= 0;
repeat
if FindColorSpiralTolerance(a1,b1,ColorArray[i],a1-(HBox),b1-(HBox),a1+(HBox),b1+(HBox),Tol) then
AllFound:=true
else
begin
ColorMissing:= true;
AllFound:= false;
break;
end;

  i:= i+1;
until i= (ArraySize-1)
if ColorMissing then break;
j:= j+1;

until AllFound or (j=10)

result:= AllFound;
end;

{*******************************************************************************
function AutoColor;
By: Roberty Bob
Description: Creates an array of unique colors for an object using a specified reference
color array, returns true if the reference array is completely refreshed.
*******************************************************************************}
function AutoColor(ObjText:string; ColorArray: array of Integer; BlackListSize:integer):boolean;
var
A,B,C, A1,B1,C1,A2,B2,C2, incA,incB,incC, incA1,incB1,incC1,incA2,incB2,incC2,
i,j, DynCount, ToleranceLimit, SearchBoxSizeLimit, ColorArraySize,
ACtempx, ACtempy, TempColor, TempMS : integer;
var
TolGood, SearchBoxGood,RefColorGood,
ColorArrayFilled, Black, Debug, OnAWinner,
EnableDualLayerSearch,EnableScriptDebugging: boolean;
var
XferColorArray: array of integer;
BlackListColorArray: array of integer;
var
DynString: string;

begin
//+++++++++++ SETUP ++++++++++++++++
//================================//
EnableScriptDebugging:= True;
EnableDualLayerSearch:= True ;
//Dual Layer will normally be overkill but it if want gaurenteed success
//================================//

// Initialise misc. variables
TempMS:= mousespeed;
benmouse:= false;
mousespeed:= 20;

// Initial loop values | boxsize | tolerance | array[ref] |
A1:= 200; // First layer - cursory scan
B1:= 5;
C1:= 1;
A2:= 10; // Second layer- intensive failproof scan.
B2:= 5;
C2:= 0;
// Loop increment sizes
incA1:= 40; // First layer - cursory scan
incB1:= 4;
incC1:= 2
incA2:= 20; // Second- more detailed scan
incB2:= 5;
incC2:= 1;
// Limiting values for the loops.
ToleranceLimit:= 20;
SearchBoxSizeLimit:= 500; //maximum size of the rectangle formed around the player.

// Initialise booleans.
TolGood:= false;
SearchBoxGood:= false;
RefColorGood:= false;
ColorArrayFilled:= false;
OnAWinner:= false;
Black:= false;
debug:= EnableScriptDebugging;

ColorArraySize:= GetArrayLength(ColorArray);
SetArrayLength(XferColorArray,ColorArraySize);
SetArrayLength(BlackListColorArray,BlackListSize);

// Initialise Arrays
i:= 0;
for i:= 0 to ColorArraySize-1 do
begin
XferColorArray[i]:= 0;
i:= i+1;
end;

i:= 0
for i:= 0 to (BlackListSize-1) do
begin
BlackListColorArray[i]:= 0;
i:=i+1;
end;

if debug then writeln(‘Initialised’);
i:= 0;
mmouse(MSCX,MSCY,10,10);
wait(100+random(100));
//-----------The Triple Iteration-----------------------------------------------
if debug then writeln(‘Starting the multilayered triple loop’);
j:= 0;
if not EnableDualLayerSearch then j:=1;
repeat

if j=0 then
begin
if debug then writeLn(‘first tier search commencing’);
A:= A1;
B:= B1;
C:= C1;
incA:= incA1;
incB:= incB1;
incC:= incC1;
end

else
begin
if debug then writeLn(‘second tier search commencing’);
A:= A2;
B:= B2;
C:= C2;
incA:= incA2;
incB:= incB2;
incC:= incC2;
end;

repeat
  if debug then writeLn('incA ='+inttostr(incA));
  B:= 0;
  repeat
    if debug then writeLn('incB ='+inttostr(incB));
    C := 0;
    repeat
      if debug then writeLn('incC ='+inttostr(incC));

      black:= false;
      if not OnAWinner then
      begin
      ACtempX:= MSCX-250+random(500);
      ACtempY:= MSCY-160+random(320);
      FindAllColorsInBoxTolerance(ACtempX,ACtempY,ColorArray,40,20);
      end;

      if debug then writeln('searching for color within limits');
      if FindColorSpiralTolerance(ACtempX,ACtempY,ColorArray[C],(MSCX-A),(MSCY-((2/3)*A)),(MSCX+A),(MSCY+((2/3)*A)),(B))
      and not IsColorInArray(ColorArray[C],BlackListColorArray,BlackListSize) then
      begin

        if debug then writeln('I''ve found a potential color for further checking!');
        MMouse(ACtempX,ACtempY,0,0);
        wait(30+random(30));

        if IsUpText(ObjText) then
        begin
          OnAWinner:=true;
          if debug then writeln('I''ve now confirmed the color exactly.');
          TempColor:= getcolor(ACtempX,ACtempY);
          i:= 0;
          repeat
            if ColorArrayFilled then break;
            begin
              if (XferColorArray[i]=0) or (XferColorArray[i]=TempColor) then
              begin
                if debug then writeln('filling temporary color transfer array');
                begin
                  XferColorArray[i]:= TempColor;
                  break;
                end;
              end;
              i:= i+1
            end;
          until (i=ColorArraySize)

          if not (XferColorArray[ColorArraySize-1]=0) then
          begin
            ColorArrayFilled:= true;
            i:= 0;
            if debug then writeln('changing the array');
            repeat
              begin
                ColorArray[i]:= XferColorArray[i];
                i:= i+1;
              end;
            until (i=ColorArraySize)
          end;
          begin
            ACtempX:=ACtempX-7+random(14);
            ACtempY:=ACtempX-7+random(14);
          end;
        end

        else
        begin
          black:= true;
          repeat
          if ColorArrayFilled then break;
            begin
              if (BlackListColorArray[i]=0) or (BlackListColorArray[i]=TempColor) then
              begin
                if debug then writeln('blacklisting a wrong color');
                BlackListColorArray[i]:= TempColor;
                break;
              end;
              i:= i+1
            end;
          until (i=BlackListSize)
        end;
      end;


      C:= C+incC;
    until (C>=ColorArraySize-1) or RefColorGood or ColorArrayFilled

    B:= B+incB;
  until (B>=ToleranceLimit) or TolGood or ColorArrayFilled

  A:= A+incA;
until (A>=(SearchBoxSizeLimit/2)) or SearchBoxGood or ColorArrayFilled

j:= j+1;
until (j>=2)

DynCount:= 0;
DynString:= ‘( ‘;
WriteLn(’’);
WriteLn(‘The colors for your chosen object have been selected’);

i:= 0;
repeat
if not (XferColorArray[i]=0) then
begin
DynCount:= DynCount+1;
DynString:= DynString+inttostr(XferColorArray[i])+’ ‘;
end;
i:= i+1;
until (i=ColorArraySize)
writeLn(‘and ‘+inttostr(DynCount)+’/’+inttostr(ColorArraySize)+’ were dynamically changed from the reference array.’);
if not (XferColorArray[0]=0) then
begin
DynString:= DynString+’)’;
writeLn('to become '+DynString);
end;

if (XferColorArray[0]=0) then
  begin
  writeLn('You really need to change the parameters. Try increasing the tolerance?');
  writeLn('');
  mousespeed:= TempMS;
  end;
mousespeed:= TempMS;

result:= ColorArrayFilled;
end;

begin
SetArray;
AutoColor(‘Attack’,ChickenColor,10);
end.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: My baby... AutoColor 2.1
item.dc:creator: @roberty_bob roberty bob
item.description:
@roberty_bob wrote:

I’ve decided to release this, so that everyone can benefit. Noobs won’t be able to configure it too well anyway.
I just ask if you use it, credit where credit is due.

There are simpler ways of achieving it… but I had fun making it… it’s an incredibly versatile and powerful AutoColor function (when used by someone who knows what they are doing… )

FIXING A BUG AT THE MOMENT.

Edit: Just remembered you will need another simple function of mine. Anything else you need is already posted in my other thread.

{*******************************************************************************
function IsColorInArray (var TheColor:integer ; TheArray: array of Integer; ArraySize:integer):boolean;
By: Roberty Bob
Description: Returns true if the specified color is found in the array.
*******************************************************************************}
function IsColorInArray (var TheColor:integer ; TheArray: array of Integer; ArraySize:integer):boolean;
var
  ColorFound: boolean;
var
  i: integer;
  
begin
  ColorFound:= false;
  i:= 0;

  repeat
    if TheArray[i]= TheColor then
    begin
      ColorFound:= true;
      break;
    end;
    i:= i+1;
  until i = (ArraySize)

result:= ColorFound;
end;

Read full topic
